group_1.narration: No matter how many times we beat them down,@the dead continue to rise again in this@impossibly peaceful Futatsugi.
In order to escape,@we changed form with the thought of drinking blood@and laid waste to the ghosts.@Alas, this battle not only drained our strength;@it drained our hearts as well.

group_1.textLeft: Even with the hearts of demons...@This is still so painful...

group_1.textRight: Still, we ain't got a choice but to@keep truckin', ya know?
Tch... Who's there?!

group_1.textCenter: P-please don't shoot!@It's just me and my buddies, see!

group_1.textRight: From the way you're talkin'...@That you, Urara?

group_1.textLeft: Thank goodness...@I'm glad you figured out it was us!
You three have gotten trapped in this@world too, hm?

group_1.textRight: Hold up, if Asahi's here, can't she just@shut her magic down or something?!
Unfortunately, that's the problem...@This place is entirely beyond my control.

group_1.textLeft: The hell you mean, it's outta your control?
Would you be able to elaborate?

group_1.textRight: Well, here's what's happened so far...

group_1.textLeft: This is a space the deceased created using@stolen magic...? I see...

group_1.textRight: And you're sayin' they're still hemmin' and hawin'@over whether they forgive us or not?
Yep!

group_1.textLeft: Then we better brace ourselves for@another attack.
I can't just let 'em murder me.

group_1.textRight: Hang on! See, they might let you two go!

group_1.textLeft: ...Eh? How can you...

group_1.textRight: The lanterns weren't all red, y'know!
I haven't...seen your guys' sins for myself,@so I don't know all the details.
But the dead Magical Girls might be trying@to patch things over!

group_1.textLeft: ...Even if they are, the hell are we@supposed to do?

group_1.textRight: I've been thinkin' about it ever since@our guide told us, see.
And maybe the girls who died can be@saved if they forgive you.
Such an act may be a way of mourning@the dead in itself.

group_1.textLeft: But mourning isn't...

group_1.textRight: You can learn their feelings.
Just now, we put your "crystals of emotion"@into the lanterns.
And essentially...
If the people who offered the flowers―the owners@of the crystals―touch the lantern,
it seems as though they will be able@to know how the dead feel.

group_1.textLeft: Is there anything we can do with@that knowledge...?

group_1.textRight: It's better than doing nothing and giving up,@at any rate...

group_1.textLeft: ...Hm...Indeed, that makes sense.@Where are the lanterns...?

group_1.textRight: In the catacombs.

group_1.textLeft: ...So we just gotta touch these things?

group_1.textRight: I have no idea what you might see.@Your Soul Gem is already cloudy...

group_1.textLeft: Don't worry about me... I will accept any abuse.
Shall we, Juri...?

group_1.textRight: ...Yeah.

group_1.narration: Sure, I was a Magical Girl, but I was also a@normal high schooler... with someone I liked.@I was going to confess my feelings to them@after the war was over...
I wanted to hold hands and go on dates@if we ever got together.@But even if I had my heart broken,@I knew that'd still be a fond memory@to look back on when I grew up.
...I never imagined I was going to die.
My birthday was coming up soon,@and I was gonna have a homemade cake from Mama,@big enough for our whole family to share and@topped with my favorite strawberries.
When I grew up, my dream was to work hard@and give my parents a good life after all@the shit I put them through.@Some ungrateful kid I ended up being,@going off and dying before them.

Even though I was a Magical Girl,@I thought I'd get to marry the love of my@life one day and have a family.@I figured that everyday happiness would@just come naturally to me.@I sure was a total idiot, huh...?
I never longed for much.@I just wanted to take it one day at a time,@laugh with somebody about dumb stuff,@kill some Witches, live a normal life...@If only I coulda spent my days like that.
"...Ah, these are the futures we robbed away@from those girls..."
"But they have died, and now these futures@will never come again..."
"Yeah, and to think it was somethin' so simple...@I wanted to apologize, but I never told 'em properly."

group_1.textRight: I shoulda said this sooner, but...sorry.
There was no way around the fightin'.@It was inevitable.
But I still feel bad for everyone who died@because of us.
...I'm really sorry I robbed this from you guys.
No amount of nice words will make it forgivable,@and apologizin' won't make it go away.
Still, I should've told you I was sorry.

group_1.textLeft: No matter how many times I apologize, it's not@enough. Everyone's voices still echo in my mind.
I should have said it more often...@I'm truly sorry, girls...

group_1.textRight: I'm ready to accept whatever punishment@you give me.
I'll accept all your grudges.@If you wanna kill me, go ahead and try.
But we've still got people we wanna protect@and a future to look forward to.
So even if you put us on the choppin' block,@we're gonna take a stand.
Besides...
The types of sins we committed ain't gonna be@forgiven by dying.

group_1.textLeft: ...Is that the answer?

group_1.textCenter: For the two of them to reaffirm their guilt@and apologize for their crimes...?

group_1.textRight: The lanterns haven't changed colour...

group_1.textLeft: Ah! Look!
Wh... The lanterns are glowing...
